00036 // File local defines
00038 #define DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME                         "raw_values.dat"                                        
00039 #define DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME                      "parsed_values.dat"                                     
00041 #define DEF_NUM_EVENTS                                          -1                                                                      
00042 #define DEF_BASE_ADDRESS                                        0x3210                                                          
00043 #define DEF_BOARD_TYPE_STR                                      "V792A"                                                         
00044 #define DEF_V792_TYPE                                           CVT_V792_TYPE_A                                         
00045 #define DEF_ZERO_SUPPRESSION_PARAMS                     "0"                                                                     
00046 #define DEF_CONFIG_FILENAME                                     "CAENqtpDemo.conf"                                      
00047 #define DEF_GNU_PLOT_PATH                                       ""

00067 /**************************************************
00068 **************************************************/
00069 BOOL user_settings_open( user_setting_data* p_data) {
00070     // module variable init
00071     p_data->m_raw_output_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00072     p_data->m_parsed_output_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00073 
00074     p_data->m_gnu_plot_path= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00075     p_data->m_config_filename= (char*)malloc( MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT);
00076 
00077     p_data->m_gnu_plot_refresh= DEF_GNU_PLOT_REFRESH;
00078     p_data->m_gnu_plot_x_scale= DEF_GNU_PLOT_X_SCALE;
00079 
00080     // setting default values ...
00081         if ( p_data->m_raw_output_filename== NULL) {
00082         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00083         } else {
00084         strcpy( p_data->m_raw_output_filename, DEF_RAW_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00085         }
00086 
00087         if ( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename== NULL) {
00088         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00089         } else {
00090         strcpy( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename, DEF_PARSED_OUTPUT_FILENAME);
00091         }
00092 
00093         if ( p_data->m_gnu_plot_path== NULL) {
00094         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00095         } else {
00096         strcpy( p_data->m_gnu_plot_path, DEF_GNU_PLOT_PATH);
00097         }
00098 
00099         if ( p_data->m_config_filename== NULL) {
00100         TRACE("user setting module: insufficient memory !\n");
00101         } else {
00102         strcpy( p_data->m_config_filename, DEF_CONFIG_FILENAME);
00103         }
00104 
00105     p_data->m_num_events= DEF_NUM_EVENTS;
00106     p_data->m_base_address= DEF_BASE_ADDRESS;
00107     p_data->m_qtp_type= DEF_V792_TYPE;
00108 
00109         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( DEF_ZERO_SUPPRESSION_PARAMS, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_thresholds_buff);
00110         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( DEF_ZERO_SUPPRESSION_PARAMS, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_high_thresholds_buff);
00111 
00112     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_count_all_events= FALSE;
00113     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_empty_enable= FALSE;
00114     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_overflow_suppression_enable= FALSE;
00115     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_sliding_scale_enable= FALSE;
00116     p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_zero_suppression_enable= FALSE;
00117 
00118     return TRUE;
00119 }
00120 /**************************************************
00121 **************************************************/
00122 BOOL user_settings_close( user_setting_data* p_data) {
00123     // module variable free
00124     if ( p_data->m_raw_output_filename)
00125         free( p_data->m_raw_output_filename);
00126     if ( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename)
00127         free( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename);
00128 
00129     // setting invalid values ...
00130     p_data->m_raw_output_filename= NULL;
00131     p_data->m_parsed_output_filename= NULL;
00132 
00133     return TRUE;
00134 }

00136 /**************************************************
00137 **************************************************/
00138 BOOL user_settings_parse_input_param( user_setting_data* p_data, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00139     BOOL help_to_show= FALSE;
00140     int i;
00141     for ( i= 1; i< argc; i++) {
00142         if ( !strcmp( argv[i], "-h")||
00143                 !strcmp( argv[i], "-H")) {
00144             help_to_show= TRUE;
00145         } else if ( !strncmp( argv[i], "-f", 2)||
00146                     !strncmp( argv[i], "-F", 2)) {
00147             // config filename
00148             strcpy( p_data->m_config_filename, argv[i]+ 2);
00149         } else {
00150             // Unknown parameter
00151             TRACE1("\nuser settings: ignored command line parameter '%s'", argv[i]);
00152             TRACE("\n  restart with -h flag for help on usage\n");
00153             help_to_show= TRUE;
00154 
00155         }
00156     }
00157     if ( help_to_show) {
00158         // show help screen
00159         TRACE ( "\n");
00160         TRACE ( "CAEN qtp Demo usage:    CAENqtpDemo {params_list}\n");
00161         TRACE ( "params_list:\n");
00162         TRACE ( "-ffilename | -Ffilename\n");
00163         TRACE1( "      filename= configuration filename. If not specified '%s' will be assumed.\n", DEF_CONFIG_FILENAME);
00164         TRACE ( "           example: CAENqtpDemo -f\"CAENqtpDemo.conf\"\n");
00165         TRACE ( "                    CAENqtpDemo -FCAENqtpDemo.conf\n");
00166         TRACE ( "-h | -H\n");
00167         TRACE ( "      Show this help screen\n");
00168         TRACE ( "           example: CAENqtpDemo -h\n");
00169         TRACE ( "\n");
00170         TRACE ( "Hit a key to continue ... \n");
00171         while ( !kbhit());
00172         return FALSE;
00173     }
00174     if ( !parse_config_file( p_data))
00175         return FALSE;
00176     return TRUE;
00177 }
00178 /**************************************************
00179 **************************************************/
00180 BOOL parse_config_file( user_setting_data* p_data) {
00181     // char line[ 200];
00182     char org_line[ 200];
00183     char *line;
00184     char org_str[200];
00185     char *str;
00186     FILE *p_conf_file= NULL;
00187     BOOL ret_val= TRUE;
00188     char trim_space_charset[]= {' ', '\t', '\n'};
00189     char trim_text_charset[]= {' ', '\t', '"', '\n'};
00190 
00191 
00192     if ( ( p_conf_file= fopen( p_data->m_config_filename, "r"))== NULL) {
00193         TRACE1(" Cannot open configuration file %s\n", p_data->m_config_filename);
00194         return FALSE;
00195     }
00196     TRACE1(" Reading configuration file '%s' ...", p_data->m_config_filename);
00197     while (!feof( p_conf_file)) {
00198         fgets( org_line, sizeof( org_line), p_conf_file);  // read the whole line
00199                 line= trim( trim_space_charset, sizeof( trim_space_charset), org_line);;
00200         if ( !strlen( line)) {
00201             continue;
00202         }
00203                 sscanf( line, "%s", org_str);  // read one string from the file
00204         str= trim( trim_space_charset, sizeof( trim_space_charset), org_str);
00205                 line+= strlen( str);
00206         if ( !strlen( str)) {
00207             continue;
00208         }
00209         if ( str[0] == '#') {
00210             continue;
00211         }
00212 
00213         // The board base address (16 bytes MSW hex format)
00214         if ( !stricmp(str, "BASE_ADDRESS")) {
00215             int value= 0;
00216             sscanf( line, "%x", &value);
00217             p_data->m_base_address= value;
00218             continue;
00219         }
00220 
00221         // The QTP's type: Valid values are: V792A, V792N
00222         if ( !stricmp(str, "QTP_TYPE")) {
00223             char value[ 100];
00224             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00225             if ( !stricmp( value, "v792a")) {
00226                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V792_TYPE_A;
00227             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v792n")) {
00228                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V792_TYPE_N;
00229             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v862a")) {
00230                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V862_TYPE_A;
00231             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v965")) {
00232                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V965;
00233             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v965a")) {
00234                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V965_TYPE_A;
00235             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v785a")) {
00236                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V785_TYPE_A;
00237             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v785n")) {
00238                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V785_TYPE_N;
00239             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v1785")) {
00240                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V1785;
00241             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v775a")) {
00242                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V775_TYPE_A;
00243             } else if ( !stricmp( value, "v775n")) {
00244                 p_data->m_qtp_type= CVT_V775_TYPE_N;
00245             } else {
00246                 // Bad parameter
00247                 TRACE1("\nuser settings: bad QTP type '%s'", value);
00248             }
00249             continue;
00250         }
00251         // The number of events to acquire:
00252         // A non positive number means don't care (i.e. acquire until key pressed)
00253         if ( !stricmp(str, "NUM_EVENTS")) {
00254             long value= 0;
00255             sscanf( line, "%ld", &value);
00256             p_data->m_num_events= value;
00257             continue;
00258         }
00259         // The zero suppression threshold resolution
00260         if ( !stricmp(str, "STEP_THRESHOLD")) {
00261             int value= 0;
00262             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00263             p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_step_threshold= value;
00264             continue;
00265         }
00266         // The thresholds buffer (value and kill bit) (comma separated values)
00267                 // for dual range boards (V965, V1785) these are the low range thresholds
00268         if ( !stricmp(str, "THRESHOLDS")) {
00269             char value[ 100];
00270             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00271                         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( value, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_thresholds_buff);
00272             continue;
00273         }
00274         // The high range thresholds buffer (value and kill bit) (comma separated values) just for dual range boards (V965, V1785)
00275         if ( !stricmp(str, "THRESHOLDS_HIGH")) {
00276             char value[ 100];
00277             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00278                         parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( value, p_data->m_zero_suppression_param.m_high_thresholds_buff);
00279             continue;
00280         }
00281         // Enable/Disable the sliding scale feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00282         if ( !stricmp(str, "SLIDING_SCALE_ENABLE")) {
00283             int value= 0;
00284             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00285             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_sliding_scale_enable= value!= 0;
00286             continue;
00287         }
00288         // Enable/Disable the zero suppression ( set a non zero value to enable)
00289         if ( !stricmp(str, "ZERO_SUPPRESSION_ENABLE")) {
00290             int value= 0;
00291             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00292             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_zero_suppression_enable= value!= 0;
00293             continue;
00294         }
00295         // Enable/Disable the overflow suppression feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00296         if ( !stricmp(str, "OVERFLOW_SUPPRESSION_ENABLE")) {
00297             int value= 0;
00298             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00299             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_overflow_suppression_enable= value!= 0;
00300             continue;
00301         }
00302         // Enable/Disable empty event storing feature ( set a non zero value to enable)
00303         if ( !stricmp(str, "EMPTY_ENABLE")) {
00304             int value= 0;
00305             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00306             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_empty_enable= value!= 0;
00307             continue;
00308         }
00309         // Enable/Disable counting all triggers or accepted one only ( set a non zero value to enable)
00310         if ( !stricmp(str, "COUNT_ALL_EVENTS")) {
00311             int value= 0;
00312             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00313             p_data->m_acquisition_mode_param.m_count_all_events= value!= 0;
00314             continue;
00315         }
00316         // enable debugging
00317         if (!stricmp(str, "DEBUG")) {
00318             int value= 0;
00319             sscanf(line, "%d", &value);
00320             p_data->m_debug= value!= 0;
00321             continue;
00322         }
00323         // The path of the for where the gnuplot executable is installed
00324         if (!stricmp(str, "GNUPLOT_PATH")) {
00325             char value[ MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT];
00326                         value[0]= '\0';
00327             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00328             strcpy( p_data->m_gnu_plot_path, trim( trim_text_charset, sizeof( trim_text_charset), value));
00329             continue;
00330         }
00331         // Gnu plot refresh rate (msec)
00332         if (!stricmp(str, "GNU_PLOT_REFRESH")) {
00333             int value= 0;
00334             sscanf( line, "%d", &value);
00335             p_data->m_gnu_plot_refresh= value;
00336             continue;
00337         }
00338         // GnuPlot X conversion factor
00339         if (!stricmp(str, "GNU_PLOT_X_SCALE")) {
00340             float value= 0;
00341             sscanf(line, "%f", &value);
00342             p_data->m_gnu_plot_x_scale= value;
00343             continue;
00344         }
00345         // Raw readout data log filename: set to empty string to disable log
00346         if (!stricmp(str, "RAW_LOG_FILENAME")) {
00347             char value[ MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT];
00348                         value[0]= '\0';
00349             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00350             strcpy( p_data->m_raw_output_filename, trim( trim_text_charset, sizeof( trim_text_charset), value));
00351             continue;
00352         }
00353         // Parsed readout data log filename: set to empty string to disable log
00354         if (!stricmp(str, "PARSED_LOG_FILENAME")) {
00355             char value[ MAX_FILENAME_LENGHT];
00356                         value[0]= '\0';
00357             sscanf( line, "%s", value);
00358             strcpy( p_data->m_parsed_output_filename, trim( trim_text_charset, sizeof( trim_text_charset), value));
00359             continue;
00360         }
00361     }
00362     TRACE(  " Done \n");
00363     fclose( p_conf_file);
00364     return ret_val;
00365 }
00366 
00367 char* trim( char charset[], int n_chars, const char* string) {
00368     int i;
00369     char* str= (char* )string;
00370     BOOL found_char;
00371     // Trim leading chars
00372     found_char= TRUE;
00373     while ( found_char&& strlen( str) ) {
00374         found_char= FALSE;
00375         for ( i= 0; i< n_chars; i++) {
00376             if ( str[0]== charset[ i]) {
00377                 found_char= TRUE;
00378                 ++str;
00379                 break;
00380             }
00381         }
00382     }
00383     // Trim trailing chars
00384     found_char= TRUE;
00385     while ( found_char&& strlen( str) ) {
00386         found_char= FALSE;
00387         for ( i= 0; i< n_chars; i++) {
00388             if ( str[ strlen( str)- 1]== charset[ i]) {
00389                 found_char= TRUE;
00390                 str[ strlen( str)- 1]= '\0';
00391                 break;
00392             }
00393         }
00394     }
00395     return str;
00396 }
00397 BOOL parse_zero_suppression_thresholds( const char* line, UINT16 *thresholds_buff) {
00398     int i;
00399     const char* tok;
00400     char buff[ 300];
00401         char trim_text_charset[]= {'"'};
00402 
00403     strncpy( buff, trim( trim_text_charset, 300, line), 300);
00404     memset( thresholds_buff, 0, MAX_THRESHOLD_NUM* sizeof( thresholds_buff[ 0]));
00405     tok= strtok( buff, ", ");
00406     for ( i= 0; ( i< MAX_THRESHOLD_NUM)&& tok; i++) {
00407         int tmp= 0;
00408         if ( !strnicmp( tok, "0x", 2)) {
00409             // hex format
00410             sscanf( tok+ 2, "%x", &tmp);
00411         } else {
00412             // decimal format
00413             tmp= atoi( tok);
00414         }
00415         thresholds_buff[ i]= (UINT16)tmp;
00416         tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00417     }
00418     return TRUE;
00419 }
00420 BOOL parse_acquisition_mode_param( const char* line, acquisition_mode_param *target) {
00421     const char* tok;
00422     char buff[ 300];
00423 
00424     strncpy( buff, line, 300);
00425 
00426     tok= strtok( buff, ", ");
00427     if ( !tok)
00428         return FALSE;
00429     target->m_sliding_scale_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00430 
00431     tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00432     if ( !tok)
00433         return FALSE;
00434     target->m_zero_suppression_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00435 
00436     tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00437     if ( !tok)
00438         return FALSE;
00439     target->m_overflow_suppression_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00440 
00441     tok= strtok( NULL, ", ");
00442     if ( !tok)
00443         return FALSE;
00444     target->m_empty_enable= atoi( tok)? TRUE: FALSE;
00445 
00446     return TRUE;
00447 }
